item.title: Cameron add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Cameron add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cameron add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Isadora Duncan
item.description: "It has taken me years of struggle, hard work, and research to learn to make one simple gesture, and I know enough about the art of writing to realize that it would take as many years of concentrated effort to write one simple, beautiful sentence." -- Isadora Duncan

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "People say that what we’re all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think that’s what we’re really seeking. I think that what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive, so that our life experiences on the purely physical plane will have resonances with our own innermost being and reality, so that we actually feel the rapture of being alive." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "Eat food. Not too much. Mostly plants." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Cameron add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson
